content.description:
A Final Act of Defiance

Hic HecubaHecuba, -ae, f.: Hecuba (the wife of Priam) et nataenata, -ae, f. = filia, -ae nequiquamnequiquam, adv. = frustra altariaaltaria, -ae, f. = ara, -ae circum 
condensaecondensus, -a, -um, adj.: crowded together et divum amplexae simulacrasimulacrum, -i, n. = statua, -ae sedebant. 
Ipsum autem sumptis PriamumPriamus, -i, m.: Priam (the king of Troy) iuvenalibusiuvenalis, -e, adj.: youthful armis
ut vidit, “Quae mens tam diradirus, -a, -um, adj.: terrible, miserrime coniunx?”
content.question: In line 3 (ipsum...armis), which of the following sets of words is an example of synchysis?

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
